The alleged screenshot of the CNN websit: Doctors encourage covid-19 vaccine injections in penis" was analyzed and found to have several differences compared to the actual CNN website. These differences included the presence of a full stop in the headline, which is not a common practice in CNN articles, and discrepancies in the alignment of the headline and report's cutline.
The University of California was checked: and it was confirmed that no study had been published regarding the administration of COVID-19 vaccines through the penis. This contradicted the claim made in the screenshot.
A reverse image search was conducted on: s picture in the viral screenshot, and it was discovered that the image belonged to Dr. Mohitkumar Ardeshana, a New York-based doctor associated with BioTE Medical. This indicated that the image was being misrepresented in the context of the claim.
The Centers for Disease Control and Prev: CDC) guidelines were referred to, which clearly stated that both the Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna COVID-19 vaccines are administered via intramuscular injection in the deltoid muscle, located in the uppermost part of the arm and the top of the shoulder. This contradicted the claim that the vaccine should be injected into the penis.
